The task is to identify a specific game where the Detroit Pistons, despite being significantly outpaced at halftime, managed to secure a victory that turned around their season. Based on the context provided and historical knowledge, this appears to refer to Game 5 of the 2004 Eastern Conference Finals.

**Answer:**

The game in question is **Game 5 of the 2004 Eastern Conference Finals**, played against the New Jersey Nets on June 1, 2004. At halftime, the Pistons trailed 71-32, a deficit of 39 points. However, they managed to overcome this deficit and win the game 120-96. This comeback was one of the most remarkable in basketball history, showcasing the resilience and determination of the Detroit Pistons, ultimately contributing to their eventual NBA Championship victory.

This significant win not only turned around the series but also marked a turning point in the Pistons' playoff run, highlighting their ability to recover from insurmountable deficits.
